connector.description: Publish or search for events in Splunk.

camel.sink.endpoint.connectionTimeout.name: camel.sink.endpoint.connectionTimeout
camel.sink.endpoint.connectionTimeout.description: Timeout in MS when connecting to Splunk server

camel.sink.endpoint.eventHost.name: camel.sink.endpoint.eventHost
camel.sink.endpoint.eventHost.description: Override the default Splunk event host field

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.sink.endpoint.raw.name: camel.sink.endpoint.raw
camel.sink.endpoint.raw.description: Should the payload be inserted raw

camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous.name: camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous
camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used, or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

camel.sink.endpoint.sslProtocol.name: camel.sink.endpoint.sslProtocol
camel.sink.endpoint.sslProtocol.description: Set the ssl protocol to use One of: [TLSv1.2] [TLSv1.1] [TLSv1] [SSLv3]

camel.sink.endpoint.useSunHttpsHandler.name: camel.sink.endpoint.useSunHttpsHandler
camel.sink.endpoint.useSunHttpsHandler.description: Use sun.net.www.protocol.https.Handler Https handler to establish the Splunk Connection. Can be useful when running in application servers to avoid app. server https handling.

camel.component.splunk.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.component.splunk.lazyStartProducer
camel.component.splunk.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.splunk.autowiredEnabled.name: camel.component.splunk.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.splunk.autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.
